pullRequest.body:
We define proper morphisms of schemes and show standard stability properties.

Partly from the valuative criterion project.

Co-authored by: Andrew Yang

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

`+ IsProper`

`+ instance : MorphismProperty.IsMultiplicative @UniversallyClosed`

`+ isProper_eq`

ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by jcommelin.
Good catch, I fixed the docstring.

Thanks!

bors merge
Thanks for all the reviews!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11394057915/job/31703597677)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11394057915/job/31703597469)
maintainer merge

This looks great to me apart from the fact that the docstring is totally incorrect. I'm a bit confused about whether I can bors merge given that Andrew Yang, one of my own PhD students, is listed as an author of the main file.

I haven't really been following algebraic geometry for a while; I'm attempting to get more into this area now I have more time for Lean. These proofs that various morphism properties are stable under composition etc look really nice!
:tada:
maintainer merge
:tada:

This looks great to me apart from the fact that the docstring is totally incorrect. I'm a bit confused about whether I can bors merge given that Andrew Yang, one of my own PhD students, is listed as an author of the main file.

I haven't really been following algebraic geometry for a while; I'm attempting to get more into this area now I have more time for Lean. These proofs that various morphism properties are stable under composition etc look really nice!
?! This isn't the right docstring at all?
The docstring should be updated here.

Have you formalised this in another repository already? If so, I believe it is ok to keep the definition as is.
Otherwise, I believe you should at least add a pointer to this https://mathoverflow.net/questions/23337/is-a-universally-closed-morphism-of-schemes-quasi-compact (I have not looked at the details yet, but I would give some trust the author of the answer...)
It is in the valuative criterion project.

More specifically: Here https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/742d3b40eefe44b43da330ed7fc55d19dc82d50c/Mathlib/ValuativeCriterion/UniversallyClosed.lean#L450 And it is exactly the proof you linked to above.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(AlgebraicGeometry): proper morphisms of schemes
